channel.title: Comments on: Fear the Power of the Visa

item.title: By: Aufero
item.dc:creator: Aufero
item.content:encoded:
I’m not saying ‘never’ either, but after dealing with SOE over the years, this step comes as no shock. It’s all about making the quickest buck possible, and this is the quickest possible buck. I had to laugh at Smedley’s explanation: 40% of our CS time is spent dealing with people who’ve broken the rules and are unhappy about it, so let’s make the customers who weren’t breaking the rules unhappy instead. That’ll show ’em!

Screw trying to make the advancement process interesting enough that people actually want to play our game instead of skipping most of it – we’ll make it boring as hell and take cash to get to the fun. Farmers camping quest-drop spawns 24/7 so people trying to have fun in the game can’t? Hey, more cash for us.

I guess I wouldn’t mind the whole thing so much if they included a mandatory course with each account sold: “How not to be a retard in groups, in 10 easy lessons.”

item.title: By: Byron Ellacott
item.dc:creator: Byron Ellacott
item.description:
The only thing that surprises me about the Sony market is that it took so long. An opportunity to make more money outta the game, and they weren't all over it?
Will Blizzard be able to keep pointing the finger at the evil gold selling chinese farmers and saying, "they are to blame for the economy!" in face of this?
